ACCOUNTABLE.Defintion: Someone who is accountable is completely responsible for what they do and must be able to give a satisfactory reason for it

AT FIRST GLANCE.Defintion: to give a quick short look

BLESSING.Defintion: something that is extremely lucky or makes you happy

COMMODITIES.Defintion: a substance or product that can be traded, bought, or sold

CONFLICT.Defintion: an active disagreement between people with opposing opinions or principles

CURRENCY.Defintion: the money that is used in a particular country at a particular time

CURSE.Defintion: a cause of trouble and unhappiness

DISPROVE.Defintion: to prove that something is not true

EXCEPTIONS.Defintion: someone or something that is not included in a rule, group, or list or that does not behave in the expected way

EXCREMENT.Defintion: the solid waste that is released from the bowels of a person or animal

FALLEN PREY.Defintion: to suddenly begin to suffer as a result of something or someone bad

FILTER.Defintion: a tool for selecting or removing a particular type of information

FOUNDATIONS.Defintion: an occasion when an organisation, state, etc. is established

GDP PER CAPITA.Defintion: the total value of all the goods and services produced by a country in a particular year, divided by the number of people living there

HANDFUL.Defintion: an amount of something that can be held in one hand

INCENTIVES.Defintion: something that encourages a person to do something

INEVITABLY.Defintion: certain to happen and unable to be avoided or prevented

INFLATION.Defintion: a general, continuous increase in prices

INFLUX.Defintion: the fact of a large number of people or things arriving at the same time

LIKELIHOOD.Defintion: the chance that something will happen

NET WORTH.Defintion: the ​value of the ​assets (= property and money) ​ that a ​person or business has, after any ​debts are taken away

PLETHORA.Defintion: a very large amount of something, especially a larger amount than you need, want, or can deal with

PRESERVE.Defintion: to keep something as it is, especially in order to prevent it from decaying or being damaged or destroyed

PROFITABLE.Defintion: making or likely to make a profit, make money

PROSPER.Defintion: (of a person or a business) to be or become successful, especially financially

RELIANT.Defintion: the state of depending on or trusting in something or someone

SADDLED WITH.Defintion: to put someone in a situation in which they have to deal with something difficult or unpleasant

SHOVEL.Defintion: a tool consisting of a wide, square metal or plastic blade, usually with slightly raised sides, attached to a handle, for moving loose material such as sand, coal, or snow

TRICKLING DOWN.Defintion: relating to the idea that poor people experience positive effects when rich people get richer and spend more money

VOLATILE.Defintion: likely to change suddenly and unexpectedly, especially by getting worse
